episodes.title: Pilot
episodes.description: American football coach Ted Lasso is hired by a wealthy divorcée to coach the English soccer team AFC Richmond.

episodes.title: Biscuits
episodes.description: It's Ted's first day of coaching, and fans aren't happy. He makes little headway but remains undeterred as the team plays its first match.

episodes.title: Trent Crimm: The Independent
episodes.description: To arrange an in-depth exposé, Rebecca pairs cynical journalist Trent Crimm with Ted for a day. Ted and Roy venture into the community.

episodes.title: For the Children
episodes.description: Rebecca hosts the team's annual charity benefit, where Ted stages a reconciliation between Roy and Jamie.

episodes.title: Tan Lines
episodes.description: With his wife and son visiting from America, Ted makes drastic changes to the lineup during a critical match.

episodes.title: Two Aces
episodes.description: When Jamie refuses to train, Ted turns to talented new signing Dani Rojas—and the team is struck by an age-old curse.

episodes.title: Make Rebecca Great Again
episodes.description: Rebecca celebrates her first anniversary as a divorcée as the team plays a match in Liverpool.

episodes.title: The Diamond Dogs
episodes.description: Ted and Roy are both having relationship problems. Ted consults the Diamond Dogs while Roy has a talk with Keeley.

episodes.title: All Apologies
episodes.description: After a series of mistakes on the pitch, pressure mounts to bench Roy. Rebecca drops a bombshell.

episodes.title: The Hope That Kills You
episodes.description: Richmond plays a climactic match that will determine the fates of Ted and his club.

episodes.title: Goodbye Earl
episodes.description: AFC Richmond brings in a sports psychologist to help the team overcome their unprecedented seven game tie-streak.

episodes.title: Lavender
episodes.description: Ted is surprised by the reappearance of a familiar face. Roy tries out a new gig.

episodes.title: Do the Right-est Thing
episodes.description: Rebecca has a special visitor shadow her at work. A player's return is not welcomed by the team.

episodes.title: Carol of the Bells
episodes.description: It's Christmas in Richmond. Rebecca enlists Ted for a secret mission, Roy and Keeley search for a miracle, and the Higginses open up their home.

episodes.title: Rainbow
episodes.description: Nate learns how to be assertive from Keeley and Rebecca. Ted asks Roy for a favor.

episodes.title: The Signal
episodes.description: Ted is fired up that the new team dynamic seems to be working. But will they have a chance in the quarterfinal?

episodes.title: Headspace
episodes.description: With things turning around for Richmond, it's time for everyone to work on their issues—like Ted's discomfort, Nate's confidence, and Roy's attention.

episodes.title: Man City
episodes.description: Ted and Dr. Sharon realize they might have to meet each other halfway. Tensions are high as the team prepares for the semifinal.

episodes.title: Beard After Hours
episodes.description: After the semifinal, Beard sets out on an all-night odyssey through London in an effort to collect his thoughts.

episodes.title: No Weddings and a Funeral
episodes.description: Rebecca is stunned by a sudden loss. The team rallies to show their support, but Ted finds himself grappling with a piece of his past.

episodes.title: Midnight Train to Royston
episodes.description: A billionaire football enthusiast from Ghana makes Sam an unbelievable offer. Ted plans something special for Dr. Sharon's last day with the team.

episodes.title: Inverting the Pyramid of Success
episodes.description: Richmond gets their final chance to win promotion as Ted deals with the fallout of Trent Crimm's painfully honest exposé.

episodes.title: Smells Like Mean Spirit
episodes.description: The newly promoted AFC Richmond face mockery as pundits predict they'll finish dead last this season.

episodes.title: (I Don't Want to Go to) Chelsea
episodes.description: News of a top player looking to move to London sends the English clubs into a frenzy. Richmond play their first game back in the Premier League.
Richmond adjust to an exciting change, but Jamie has reservations. Ted learns there's something new going on back in Kansas as well.

episodes.title: Big Week
episodes.description: Everyone's feeling the pressure as Richmond gear up to play West Ham. Ted is reunited with an old friend.

episodes.title: Signs
episodes.description: With their season in a tailspin, Richmond try to right the ship against mighty Manchester City. Off the pitch, everyone faces their own setbacks.

episodes.title: Sunflowers
episodes.description: A friendly match takes the team to Amsterdam, where one night out unlocks truths for many.

episodes.title: The Strings That Bind Us
episodes.description: The Greyhounds try a new strategy that has everyone thinking outside the box. Sam prepares to host a VIP guest at Ola's.

episodes.title: We'll Never Have Paris
episodes.description: While watching Henry, Ted fights the urge to spiral when Michelle and Dr. Jacob go on a romantic trip. An online leak has massive implications for Keeley.

episodes.title: La Locker Room Aux Folles
episodes.description: Colin and Isaac's friendship is tested. Roy is asked to do a press conference.

episodes.title: International Break
episodes.description: While some of the Greyhounds head home to play for their countries in international matches, Edwin Akufo brings a business proposal to Rebecca.

episodes.title: Mom City
episodes.description: An unexpected guest has Ted on edge. When Richmond travel to Manchester for a big match, Roy and Keeley become concerned about Jamie.

episodes.title: So Long, Farewell
episodes.description: AFC Richmond play their final game of the season.

episodes.title: System
episodes.description: Carmy attempts to retrain the employees of The Original Beef of Chicagoland, but is faced with resistance; in need of back-up, he brings on a talented young chef to help.

episodes.title: Hands
episodes.description: A surprise health inspection reveals the cracks in the restaurant's foundation. Carmy goes head-to-head with Richie.

episodes.title: Brigade
episodes.description: Carmy attends Al-Anon. Sydney struggles to gain the respect of the staff.

episodes.title: Dogs
episodes.description: Carmy and Richie cater a kid's birthday party. Tina and Sydney work together while Marcus makes donuts.

episodes.title: Sheridan
episodes.description: Things go wrong in the kitchen. Sydney finds solutions.

episodes.title: Ceres
episodes.description: Richie notices the neighborhood is changing. Sugar and Carmy clean up the office.

episodes.title: Review
episodes.description: A bad day in the kitchen causes tensions to rise.

episodes.title: Braciole
episodes.description: Things get out of control. Carmy is faced with a decision.

episodes.title: Beef
episodes.description: Faced with the reality of opening a new restaurant, the crew must make a plan.

episodes.title: Pasta
episodes.description: The crew splits up to work towards their new vision.

episodes.title: Sundae
episodes.description: Sydney searches Chicago for culinary inspiration.

episodes.title: Honeydew
episodes.description: Marcus challenges himself.

episodes.title: Pop
episodes.description: The renovation gets off track.

episodes.title: Fishes
episodes.description: Feast of the Seven Fishes.

episodes.title: Forks
episodes.description: Richie stages.

episodes.title: Bolognese
episodes.description: The crew awaits a do-or-die fire suppression test.

episodes.title: Omelette
episodes.description: Final preparations are made for The Bear's first service.

episodes.title: The Bear
episodes.description: Friends & Family night at The Bear.

episodes.title: Tomorrow
episodes.description: The next day and the days that led to it.

episodes.title: Next
episodes.description: Carmy sets a new standard.

episodes.title: Doors
episodes.description: The staff slogs through a month of service.

episodes.title: Violet
episodes.description: Sydney gets a new apartment. Marcus finds inspiration.

episodes.title: Children
episodes.description: The Computer gives The Bear its odds.

episodes.title: Napkins
episodes.description: Tina looks for a new opportunity.

episodes.title: Legacy
episodes.description: The restaurant is out of C-Folds. Sydney is presented with an opportunity.

episodes.title: Ice Chips
episodes.description: Sugar finds support in an unexpected place.

episodes.title: Apologies
episodes.description: Carmy thinks about apologizing.

episodes.title: Forever
episodes.description: Another funeral.

episodes.title: Groundhogs
episodes.description: Today looks like yesterday.

episodes.title: Soubise
episodes.description: Gears start to turn.

episodes.title: Scallop
episodes.description: Opportunity.

episodes.title: Worms
episodes.description: Decisions.

episodes.title: Replicants
episodes.description: The team resets.

episodes.title: Sophie
episodes.description: Sophie's here.

episodes.title: Bears
episodes.description: The wedding.

episodes.title: Green
episodes.description: Everyone keeps going.

episodes.title: Tonnato
episodes.description: Carmy takes a ride.

episodes.title: Goodbye
episodes.description: Time waits for no one.

episodes.title: Pilot
episodes.description: When the staff relates their needs, Principal Ava presents alternative options.

episodes.title: Light Bulb
episodes.description: Janine takes it upon herself to fix every problem when she notices a flicking light bulb in the hallway. Gregory asks Barbara for help talking to a parent, which leads him to spend his lunch period in an unexpected way.

episodes.title: Wishlist
episodes.description: The teachers to ask the local community for new school supplies. Janine takes to TikTok and with Ava’s assistance, her video is a success and goes viral. Janine encourages Gregory to decorate his classroom.

episodes.title: New Tech
episodes.description: When a new computer program is introduced at Abbott, Janine is excited to finally help Barbara with something. Barbara is reluctant to accept change and finds herself in a tricky situation. Melissa surprises Jacob.

episodes.title: Student Transfer
episodes.description: After a negative teacher review, Janine gets a confidence boost when a student gets transferred from Melissa's class into hers. Jacob tries to forge a friendship with an uninterested Gregory.

episodes.title: Gifted Program
episodes.description: Janine convinces Ava to start a gifted program at Abbott led by Jacob. However, when some students begin to feel left out, Gregory and Janine put their heads together and come up with a solution. Elsewhere, Barbara pushes a hesitant Melissa to start dating again.

episodes.title: Art Teacher
episodes.description: When the school’s art teacher retires, Janine is thrilled when the replacement ends up being her best friend from college, but things quickly turn sour when Sahar gets in the way of Melissa’s class traditions. Meanwhile, Jacob and Barbara bond over their love for gardening and decide to start a school garden; but when it turns out they don’t know how to successfully grow anything, Gregory secretly gets involved to fix all of their mistakes

episodes.title: Work Family
episodes.description: After Jacob reveals a detail about his personal life, Janine realizes she doesn't know the other teachers as well as she thought; Gregory's stern teaching approach is causing his whole class to underperform.

episodes.title: Step Class
episodes.description: Janine is thrilled when Ava asks to help her teach the after-school step class, but the two don’t see eye to eye on how to run the program. Later, when Barbara, Melissa and Jacob plan an “eat-off” to decide who makes the best pizza in Philadelphia, Gregory is forced to reveal a secret

episodes.title: Open House
episodes.description: It’s Open House night at Abbott Elementary, and while Janine prepares to meet her struggling student’s mother, the rest of the faculty uses the time to relax. Gregory is taken aback when he learns how Ava got the principal job, and later, Barbara’s daughter’s visit creates a commotion in more ways than one when

episodes.title: Desking
episodes.description: When the students start participating in a new online trend that causes disruption to the school, the teachers band together to put an end to it. Meanwhile, Mr. Johnson provides comforting life advice to Gregory; and later, the teachers finally meet Jacob’s boyfriend, Zach, who joins in to help stop the students “desking.”

episodes.title: Ava vs. Superintendent
episodes.description: With the school board threatening to pull their funds, Janine and Gregory decide to help Ava out with her presentation in front of the Superintendent. However, their plan is derailed when a curveball is thrown at Ava. Meanwhile, Barbara offends Melissa when she doesn’t agree with her blackmail idea.

episodes.title: Zoo Balloon
episodes.description: While on Abbott's annual zoo field trip, Tariq reveals that he has been offered a job in New York; Janine struggles with a big choice; Barbara starts questioning her future after finding out her favorite tuatara has been retired because of old age.

episodes.title: Development Day
episodes.description: The teachers are back for development week, a time to prepare for the upcoming year. Janine is determined to start the year off right and leave her problems at home. Ava runs a side hustle out of the school parking lot.

episodes.title: Wrong Delivery
episodes.description: After Janine gets a look at the new charter school down the street, she becomes determined to fix up Abbott and make it just as good. As Gregory goes out of his way to avoid Barbara due to an awkward situation with his personal life, and Ava takes to the school library to host a “Shark Tank”-style pitch to decide what to do with the rest of the funds from the grant.

episodes.title: Story Samurai
episodes.description: A traveling storytelling troupe Jacob used to be in visits Abbott Elementary for a day of education and entertainment. Jacob can’t wait to share this part of his past with his colleagues; but when he realizes they think the performers are corny, Janine does her best to help him embrace his nerdy side. Meanwhile, Melissa struggles with the new normal of her combined second and third grade class.

episodes.title: The Principal's Office
episodes.description: After Gregory sends a disruptive student to the principal’s office, he’s dismayed to find out the kids actually enjoy spending the supposed disciplinary time with Ava. Meanwhile, Melissa invites Janine over to her house to teach her how to cook, but Janine becomes determined to reunite Melissa with her estranged sister

episodes.title: Juice
episodes.description: Janine is thrilled to help introduce a new beverage to the cafeteria, but it ends up causing unexpected consequences for the students, teachers and school plumbing system. Elsewhere, Melissa clashes with her new aide, Ashley, who brings more disruption than help to the classroom.

episodes.title: Candy Zombies
episodes.description: It’s Halloween at Abbott Elementary! When a student steals a bag of candy meant to be given out to the kids at the end of the day and starts distributing it during school hours, the teachers band together to find the culprit. Meanwhile, Janine is invited to a Halloween party by an old friend and starts to reconsider her personal life.

episodes.title: Attack Ad
episodes.description: The teachers are appalled after seeing a commercial in support of charter schools criticizing Abbott Elementary. When students begin to transfer schools, Jacob, Ava and Melissa invite the leader of the charter school organization to Abbott and ask him to take down the ad. Elsewhere, Janine and Gregory talk about Janine’s relationship with Tariq .

episodes.title: Egg Drop
episodes.description: When the eighth-grade science class participates in an egg drop activity, Janine insists her second-grade class joins in. Even when the science teacher and Gregory tell her that her students aren’t ready for physics lessons, Janine is determined to prove them wrong. Then, when Barbara is shocked at the clothing one of her student’s parents wears, she learns to not judge someone solely based on their appearance.

episodes.title: Sick Day
episodes.description: Janine is out sick for the day; but with the substitute teacher shortage, Ava grows desperate and must step in herself to help out. She starts the day in an unconventional fashion, disrupting the students’ typical routine as well as neighboring classrooms. Meanwhile, Barbara and Melissa revel in the quieter-than-normal teacher’s lounge.

episodes.title: Holiday Hookah
episodes.description: On the last day of school before winter break, Janine is convinced by her friend to go to a popular hookah club where she runs into unexpected colleagues. Elsewhere, Jacob crashes Barbara and Melissa's traditional holiday dinner and in the process begins to learn the true meaning of Christmas.

episodes.title: Read-a-Thon
episodes.description: The competition heats up between Melissa and Janine as their classrooms go head-to-head in a read-a-thon sponsored by a local pizza shop. Both teachers encourage their students to hit the books hard but face some unexpected obstacles on their path to pizza glory. Meanwhile, Jacob and Gregory join forces and attempt to get their student-podcasting club off the ground.

episodes.title: Fight
episodes.description: During a day of touchdowns and missed plays, the Abbott Elementary faculty find themselves learning lessons in teamwork. Two of Janine’s students aren’t getting along in class, leading her to seek advice from her colleagues on how to help repair their friendship. Meanwhile, Melissa and Ava plot to bring down Mr. Johnson in fantasy football.

episodes.title: Fundraiser
episodes.description: Barbara organizes a candy-selling fundraiser to raise money for a school field trip to the science museum. When sales don’t go as planned, Ava steps in to teach the students new, unconventional selling tactics. Elsewhere, Mr. Johnson and Jacob butt heads about how to take care of a cat found in the janitor’s closet.

episodes.title: Valentine's Day
episodes.description: On Valentine’s Day, the Abbott teachers discuss their relationships and plans for the holiday. Janine finds out one of her students has a crush on her and when turning to a colleague for advice, she inadvertently learns a secret about another teacher. Elsewhere, Ava sits in on Jacob’s Black History class after receiving a complaint

episodes.title: Fire
episodes.description: Barbara’s candle accidentally starts a small fire in the teacher’s lounge and a counselor suggests that she might not be handling the aftermath well. Meanwhile, Melissa rekindles her childhood dream of being a firefighter.

episodes.title: Teacher Conference
episodes.description: The Abbott staff heads to the Pennsylvania Educational Conference. Gregory reluctantly attends after a disagreement with Amber and bonds with Janine over their similarities. Jacob finds himself charmed by the Addington teachers.

episodes.title: Mural Arts
episodes.description: Jacob secures a visit from a mural arts program for his students but doesn’t agree with their chosen design and attempts to influence their decision. Barbara and Melissa learn parents are petitioning to turn Abbott into a Legendary charter school.

episodes.title: Teacher Appreciation
episodes.description: It’s Teacher Appreciation Day. When the district gives Abbott two courtside tickets to a 76ers game, the teachers must decide who deserves them. Later, Janine invites the teachers to her house for game night and her sister, Ayesha, comes to visit.

episodes.title: Festival
episodes.description: Abbott Elementary rallies together to fight the threat from Legendary Charter Schools. Ava pitches a festival to draw parents to school and collect their signatures for a petition. However, Draemond shows up with the intention of derailing the event.

episodes.title: Educator of the Year
episodes.description: Gregory is named Educator of the Year. Later, Janine deals with a difficult student, and it's revealed that Barbara hasn't completed her teaching requirements.

episodes.title: Mom
episodes.description: Janine's plan for a Memorial Day weekend solo trip is derailed when her mother shows up unannounced asking for help; Gregory notices his colleagues are great at small talk and realizes he needs to brush up on his people skills.

episodes.title: Franklin Institute
episodes.description: Abbott Elementary takes a field trip to the Franklin Institute; Gregory is eager to spend time with a reluctant Janine; Ava teaches the students about aliens, which leads to chaos.

episodes.title: Career Day (1) / Career Day (2)
episodes.description: It's a new year at Abbott Elementary, and Janine is as eager as ever. She plans a district-wide initiative - Career Day - and is anxious for it to be a success. Meanwhile, Ava has a new approach to her job, and Melissa is asked a surprising question.

episodes.title: Gregory's Garden Goofballs
episodes.description: Gregory is hesitant when kids start hanging out in his classroom at lunch, looking to him for advice; Barbara is shocked to find Tariq is dating the mother of one of her students; Janine and Jacob try to hire an ASL interpreter.

episodes.title: Smoking
episodes.description: After a student is caught smoking, the Abbott staff come together to revamp the outdated drug policy. Meanwhile, Janine tries to prep the new substitute teacher for her class but finds it challenging to give up her former role.

episodes.title: Breakup
episodes.description: When Barbara's church choir uses the gym for rehearsals, Ava notices tension in the group. Jacob's eagerness for a full social calendar worries Gregory. Melissa and Janine investigate a new substitute.

episodes.title: Willard R. Abbott
episodes.description: Abbott Elementary is deemed a Philadelphia historical landmark, much to Ava and Janine’s delight; however, Barbara and Melissa are not as impressed. The school plans a celebration in honor of its namesake, but not everything goes as planned.

episodes.title: Librarian
episodes.description: Janine spearheads a pilot program that brings a librarian to Abbott; however, when friction arises with one of the teachers, it strains Janine's relationships with both parties. Meanwhile, both Melissa and Jacob deal with some big changes at home.

episodes.title: Panel
episodes.description: Ava and Gregory are invited to speak on a panel about public schools. Elsewhere, the other teachers must complete CPR training, and Janine faces challenges securing district approval for her librarian extension program.

episodes.title: Alex
episodes.description: Jacob is shocked when he finds out his colleagues are not invested in his frequent email messages and haven’t even been writing their own replies. Meanwhile, Gregory turns to Janine for help with a former student.

episodes.title: 2 Ava 2 Fest
episodes.description: Ava Fest is back, and with the help of the teachers, Ava’s set on outdoing last year by any means necessary. After Janine accepts the offer for a full-time position at the district, she just has to check off one last thing to make it official.

episodes.title: Double Date
episodes.description: Two teachers head out on a double date, but when they run into familiar bar patrons, it proves to be an unfortunate distraction. At Ava’s first book club meeting, the group ends up in a debate over who would be the best post-apocalyptic leader.

episodes.title: Mother's Day
episodes.description: Barbara invites Gregory to her family’s Mother’s Day brunch. Jacob scrambles to figure out how to organize a school field trip.

episodes.title: Smith Playground
episodes.description: Jacob manages to pull off a schoolwide field trip to the park; however, when Abbott must share the playground, the fun and games turn competitive. Elsewhere, Mr. Johnson enjoys having an empty school to himself.

episodes.title: Party
episodes.description: It’s the last day of school! Ahead of summer vacation, Janine throws the perfect end-of-year party for her colleagues and friends, taking all their interests into consideration.

episodes.title: Back to School
episodes.description: The neighboring construction site of a new golf course causes issues at Abbott, forcing the teachers to find creative solutions; an HR representative visits the school; following their kiss, Janine and Gregory's relationship status is revealed.

episodes.title: Ringworm
episodes.description: When it’s revealed that a student in Jacob’s class has ringworm, the faculty must band together to stop it from spreading through the entire school.

episodes.title: Class Pet
episodes.description: Janine gets a budget for class pets, but Melissa is resistant to taking on the added work and responsibility for her room's guinea pig; an IT rep from the school district arrives to set up new computers.

episodes.title: Costume Contest
episodes.description: It’s Halloween at Abbott Elementary! Janine and Gregory proudly show off their couple’s costume, but it fails to translate. Meanwhile, Barbara faces pushback from parents concerned about hygiene and her beloved apple-bobbing tradition.

episodes.title: Dad Fight
episodes.description: Gregory forms a bond with one of his students, but the student’s dad becomes jealous of their relationship and seeks a confrontation. Melissa suffers a fall but avoids receiving medical attention for the injury.

episodes.title: The Deli
episodes.description: When the neighborhood deli is forced to close to make room for a trendy smoothie place, Melissa, Barbara and Jacob team up to fight the gentrification. Meanwhile, the district asks Ava to give a presentation to fellow principals.

episodes.title: Winter Show
episodes.description: Despite a few setbacks, Barbara is determined to make Abbott Elementary’s first-ever holiday show a success. Meanwhile, Jacob’s brother arrives for his visit earlier than planned.

episodes.title: Winter Break
episodes.description: Melissa hosts the Schemmenti family Christmas Eve dinner and goes to great lengths to make sure everything is perfect. Meanwhile, Janine and Gregory get an unexpected guest.

episodes.title: Volunteers
episodes.description: Ava announces the school district is sending a group of volunteers to help out at Abbott. However, when they arrive, things don’t go as planned.

episodes.title: Testing
episodes.description: Janine must rethink her lesson plans after her class performs poorly on a practice test, while Jacob struggles to engage a disinterested student. The district sends a new custodian to train under Mr. Johnson.

episodes.title: Strike
episodes.description: City buses have stopped running due to a strike, resulting in many students being absent from school. The teachers at Abbott try to find creative solutions and adapt to hybrid learning. Meanwhile, Gregory and O’Shon strike up a friendship.

episodes.title: Girard Creek
episodes.description: The Abbott Elementary students and staff are invited to a special grand opening preview of the Girard Creek Golf Club.

episodes.title: The Science Fair
episodes.description: While supervising the kids making their science fair projects, the teachers' competitive sides come out.

episodes.title: District Budget Meeting
episodes.description: Ava and the Abbott teachers plan for the annual school district budget meeting. Janine and Gregory prepare for Valentine's Day as a couple

episodes.title: 100th Day of School
episodes.description: During Abbott's 100th day of school celebrations, Barbara receives a surprise from her daughter. Jacob and Mr. Johnson join forces to conduct a search party.

episodes.title: Books
episodes.description: A debate over a controversial book leads Ava to remove it from the library, but some parents push for its return.

episodes.title: Karaoke
episodes.description: When the teachers hit a karaoke bar for a night of fun, Jacob bumps into an old friend.

episodes.title: Audit
episodes.description: Ava and the teachers must band together to hide the golf-course contraband.

episodes.title: Music Class
episodes.description: Barbara and Gregory are in over their heads when they find themselves in new roles at Abbott Elementary.

episodes.title: Ava Fest: Tokyo Drift
episodes.description: The Abbott teachers turn their open house into a car wash to help raise money for the school.

episodes.title: Rally
episodes.description: Ava and the Abbott teachers go to the district to plead for Ava’s job back. Meanwhile, Gregory handles duties as interim principal.

episodes.title: Please Touch Museum
episodes.description: Abbott Elementary goes on a schoolwide field trip to the Please Touch Museum, which has some of the older kids skeptical.

episodes.title: Team Building
episodes.description: The teachers prepare for the upcoming school year with new faces and big changes on the horizon.

episodes.title: Cheating
episodes.description: Melissa tries to outsmart her students; Tariq causes chaos in Janine's class; a new guidance counselor joins the school.

episodes.title: Ballgame
episodes.description: The Abbott crew heads to the ballpark for Teachers' Appreciation Night at the Philadelphia Phillies game.

episodes.title: Game Night
episodes.description: Gregory steps in to host game night at his apartment. Mr. Johnson, Ava, Barbara and Melissa head to the DMV to renew their licenses.

episodes.title: Camping
episodes.description: Barbara organizes a Halloween camping trip for older kids.

episodes.title: No Phones
episodes.description: Abbott Elementary participates in the district’s "No Phones Day" initiative.

episodes.title: Goofgirl
episodes.description: A new member joins Gregory's Garden Goofballs, and Janine pitches a new club idea to Ava.

episodes.title: Birthday
episodes.description: Jacob takes the lead on organizing Abbott's annual winter show, and Janine celebrates her 30th birthday.

episodes.title: Mall (1)
episodes.description: Abbott Elementary returns from winter break at their new temporary school: an abandoned mall. The teachers deal with unique challenges that come with teaching in the new location.

episodes.title: Mall (2): Questions & Concerns
episodes.description: Growing pains hit Abbott Elementary as the PTA pressures Janine and Gregory for answers. Meanwhile, Jacob and Barbara become suspicious of Mr. Morton.

episodes.title: Mall (3): Heroes
episodes.description: After the faculty finds surprising success operating the school in the mall, they quickly realize they are being taken advantage of. Meanwhile, a new custodian arrives to join Mr. Johnson.

episodes.title: Picture Day
episodes.description: When picture day catches the teachers at Abbott by surprise, chaos ensues.

episodes.title: Good News About Hell
episodes.description: Mark is promoted to lead a team who've had their memories surgically divided between their work and personal lives.

episodes.title: Half Loop
episodes.description: The team train new hire Helly on macrodata refinement. Mark takes a day off to meet with a mysterious former colleague.

episodes.title: In Perpetuity
episodes.description: Mark takes the team on a field trip, but Helly continues to rebel. A deteriorating Petey struggles to tell Mark about Lumon’s misdeeds.

episodes.title: The You You Are
episodes.description: Irving finds an intriguing book at work. Helly aggressively pursues a meeting with her Outie. Mark attends a funeral with Ms. Selvig.

episodes.title: The Grim Barbarity of Optics and Design
episodes.description: Irving and Dylan confront Burt about his lies. Mark and Helly discover a strange new department.

episodes.title: Hide and Seek
episodes.description: The team angers Cobel by forming an alliance.

episodes.title: Defiant Jazz
episodes.description: Mark and the team encounter new security measures from Cobel.

episodes.title: What's for Dinner?
episodes.description: The team prepares a plan. Mark attends Devon and Ricken’s party.

episodes.title: The We We Are
episodes.description: The team discovers troubling revelations.

episodes.title: Hello, Ms. Cobel
episodes.description: Mark returns to work under different circumstances. Secrets from the Outie world come to light.

episodes.title: Goodbye, Mrs. Selvig
episodes.description: Mark contemplates the meaning of a message.

episodes.title: Who Is Alive?
episodes.description: Mark, Helly, Irving, and Dylan search for answers.

episodes.title: Woe's Hollow
episodes.description: The team participates in a group activity.

episodes.title: Trojan's Horse
episodes.description: Tensions emerge after the team suffers a loss.

episodes.title: Attila
episodes.description: Bonds are tested. Mark continues on his path of discovery.

episodes.title: Chikhai Bardo
episodes.description: An old romance intersects with a deadly present threat.

episodes.title: Sweet Vitriol
episodes.description: Discoveries are made.

episodes.title: The After Hours
episodes.description: Mark and Devon team with an ally. Helly investigates further.

episodes.title: Cold Harbor
episodes.description: Mark forms a shaky alliance in an all-or-nothing play, while the team makes a dangerous last stand.

episodes.title: The Boy in the Iceberg
episodes.description: Two teenage siblings (Sokka and Katara) living in the South Pole discover a very strange boy (Aang), along with his pet flying bison Appa, in an iceberg. But can they trust him when he accidentally draws the war to their village's doorstep?

episodes.title: The Avatar Returns
episodes.description: Katara and Sokka discover that Aang is the long-lost Avatar and must rescue him when a firebending prince named Zuko kidnaps him.

episodes.title: The Southern Air Temple
episodes.description: Aang is excited about going home for the first time in one hundred years, but he is shocked to find out that the temple is deserted. Aang tells Sokka and Katara about his childhood as they explore the temple, but they soon discover something that Aang never expected. Meanwhile, Zuko must make repairs to his ship and the only way he can do it is to dock his ship at his rival's naval base.

episodes.title: The Warriors of Kyoshi
episodes.description: The gang arrives at Kyoshi Island and are captured by some Kyoshi warriors. When Aang reveals that he is the avatar, news quickly spreads out, eventually reaching Zuko, who then goes to Kyoshi Island to capture him.

episodes.title: The King of Omashu
episodes.description: Aang's abilities as an airbender are challenged by a strange king.

episodes.title: Imprisoned
episodes.description: In a nearby Earth Village, the gang meets a teenage earthbender named Haru. This village lives in fear of the Fire Nation, for soldiers there capture any earthbenders they can find. After Haru is captured for earthbending, Katara is compelled to rescue him.

episodes.title: The Spirit World: Winter Solstice Part 1
episodes.description: Aang and friends visit a village being terrorized by an angry spirit. Iroh is captured by Earth Kingdom soldiers.

episodes.title: Avatar Roku: Winter Solstice Part 2
episodes.description: To contact the spirit of the previous Avatar, Aang must reach a temple in the Fire Nation before the sun sets on the following day. There he will learn what he must do to restore balance to the world. Zuko must defy his banishment to follow Aang.

episodes.title: The Waterbending Scroll
episodes.description: After Katara attempts to teach Aang waterbending, but realizes that he is learning it much faster than she is, she is desperate to improve her abilities.  When Katara inadvertently stumbles across a waterbending scroll that can help improve her abilities at a pirate’s store, she decides to steal it, realizing that she couldn’t hope to afford it.

episodes.title: Jet
episodes.description: While traveling towards the North Pole, the group almost gets captured by the Fire Nation.  However, when a charismatic young man and his band of rebels attack the Fire Nation camp and rescue them, they learn that they are trying to resist the Fire Nation’s motives to expand their territory.  Katara and Aang really enjoy their time with the band of rebels, but Sokka soon discovers that they aren’t as noble as meets the eye.

episodes.title: The Great Divide
episodes.description: While on their way to the North Pole, Aang and his friends arrive at a giant canyon where two groups of refugees are bickering over who should get to go across.  Aang decides to walk across with the two groups to ensure they don’t fight one another.  However, he soon learns that the two tribes have been feuding for one hundred years and they both believe their actions are justified.  But when the predators inside the canyon start to come out, Aang is stuck trying to defend both tribes from each other and the vicious wildlife.

episodes.title: The Storm
episodes.description: Sokka accepts a job for a fisherman who is looking for someone to help him out with his fishing. After the fisherman finds out Aang is the Avatar, Aang runs away in response to the fisherman's hostile reaction. When Katara finds Aang, he begins to reveal his life before he was frozen in the iceberg. Meanwhile, after Zuko gets into a fight with his crew, Iroh tells them about Zuko's complicated past, attempting to make both sides understand each other.

episodes.title: The Blue Spirit
episodes.description: While Aang, Katara and Sokka are traveling, Sokka gets a fever. Katara and Aang try to help Sokka, when Katara also catches the fever. It's up to Aang to go up on his own to save his two friends. But before he can get the medicine he is captured by the newly promoted Admiral Zhao and put in Zhao's fortress.

episodes.title: The Fortuneteller
episodes.description: When the group tries to help a man who is being attacked by a platypus-bear, they discover that the local town has a fortuneteller named Aunt Wu in it, who has been forecasting the town's fate for years. But when Sokka and Aang discover one of the fortuneteller's most vital predictions is dead wrong, they have to develop a plan to convince the stubborn townspeople that their beloved Aunt Wu was wrong.

episodes.title: Bato of the Water Tribe
episodes.description: Aang feels neglected as Katara and Sokka reunite with Bato, an old friend of their father’s from the South Pole. They begin to reminisce on their times in the past while they wait for a message to arrive from their father. Aang believes Katara and Sokka will abandon him and go out to find their father should the message arrive. However, when the messenger gives Aang the message to give to Bato, Aang betrays his friends in a way Katara or Sokka could never imagine. However, when Zuko recruits a bounty hunter named June to track Aang down, his friendship is put to the test as he must deal with the fact that he betrayed his friends while defending himself from yet another fight.

episodes.title: The Deserter
episodes.description: Aang and his friends go to a Fire Nation town so that Aang can witness some firebending, but their plan soon goes awry when it’s discovered that he is the Avatar. Fortunately, he's rescued by an individual who serves a firebending master named Jeong Jeong who has abandoned the Fire Nation, so Aang decides to use this time to attempt to learn firebending. The firebending master, however, seems reluctant to teach Aang.

episodes.title: The Northern Air Temple
episodes.description: When Aang and his friends hear rumors about surviving airbenders, they decide to stop by the Northern Air Temple on their way to the North Pole to see for themselves. What they find is a bunch of people who are not airbenders, but have mastered the art of gliding; though this upsets Aang because they have been defacing the temple. However, there was one part of the temple where nobody has been able to enter, and what Aang and his friends discover inside spells oncoming conflict.

episodes.title: The Waterbending Master
episodes.description: When Aang tries to find the north pole, he is found by the north pole instead. As they are taken there, Aang and Katara are eager to find a waterbending master, only to discover that girls are not allowed to learn waterbending.

episodes.title: The Siege of the North Part 1
episodes.description: Zhao begins to launch his attack against the Northern Water Tribe. As the walls of the prestiged city begin to fall, the Avatar taps into the spirit world and seeks the help of one of the oldest spirits, in hopes of saving one of the most prominent areas of the world.

episodes.title: The Siege of the North Part 2
episodes.description: Aang returns from the spirit world to a big surprise. Meanwhile, Zhao and his forces continue to press deeper into the Northern Water Tribe. Iroh makes a powerful stand and Zuko struggles to keep his plan intact.

episodes.title: The Avatar State
episodes.description: Plagued with nightmares featuring the devastating power of his Avatar State, Aang and the gang meet an Earth Kingdom general who has big plans for defeating the Fire Nation. Meanwhile, Zuko and Iroh, having survived the failed attack on the North Water Tribe, have a surprise visit from Zuko's sister with seemingly good news.

episodes.title: The Cave of Two Lovers
episodes.description: On their way to Omashu, Aang, Katara, and Sokka meet a group of nomads who show them a shortcut through the "Cave of Two Lovers". But when the group becomes trapped in the cave, it's up to Aang and Katara to save the group by trusting in love, possibly questioning their relationship. Meanwhile, Iroh gets a lethal rash so Zuko and Iroh head to a small Earth Kingdom town for help, hoping their real identities will not be discovered.

episodes.title: Return to Omashu
episodes.description: Despite the shocking news the gang have just discovered, Aang insists on trying to find Bumi within Omashu's borders, even with the dangers that will await him and his friends if his real identity is discovered.  Meanwhile Azula goes in search of old friends to help her with her mission.

episodes.title: The Swamp
episodes.description: A mysterious tornado pulls the kids into a supernatural swamp where Katara, Sokka and Aang have mysterious visions. Meanwhile, Momo and Appa are chased by rogue swamp dwellers and only Aang and the gang can save them.

episodes.title: Avatar Day
episodes.description: Aang and the gang discover an Earth town that celebrates something called "Avatar Day." But when they get there and learn the festival is of "anti-Avatar" sentiment and Aang is put on trial for a crime a past incarnation allegedly committed. Looking to clear the Avatar's good name, Katara and Sokka venture back to a familiar  place to gather evidence and discover the truth.

episodes.title: The Blind Bandit
episodes.description: In search for an earthbending teacher for Aang, the kids go to an underground earthbending tournament called Earth Rumble 6, where they encounter Toph, a blind but powerful earthbending girl. After seeing her unique style of earthbending, Aang wants Toph to become his teacher, but there are complications with Toph's family.

episodes.title: Zuko Alone
episodes.description: Zuko travels by himself to an Earth Kingdom town where he meets a local boy. The two almost become friends, while Zuko suffers from flashbacks of his past.

episodes.title: The Chase
episodes.description: Tired from trying to escape a machine that shows up every time they try to sleep, Aang and the gang have to escape Azula and her team, but their exhaustion leads to a tight situation. Meanwhile, Zuko must deal with something personal, and Iroh bonds with an unlikely individual.

episodes.title: Bitter Work
episodes.description: Toph's instructing abilities come into question when Aang cannot seem to overcome a block that keeps him from earthbending. Sokka gets himself in a jam, while befriending what was, moments before, his next meal, and Iroh and Zuko begin training utilizing new philosophies and methods that originate from the other elements.

episodes.title: The Library
episodes.description: When Aang and his friends find a professor who knows of a library that contains information about the world, Sokka decides to go there to hopefully find some information to use against the Fire Nation. The library is guarded by the knowledge spirit, Wan Shi Tong, who unfortunately doesn't welcome humans into his library, because he believes they only seek information for evil purposes.

episodes.title: The Desert
episodes.description: Aang searches for Appa while Katara struggles to keep everyone together to survive in the vast desert. Meanwhile, Iroh and Zuko seek help from an ancient secret society.

episodes.title: The Serpent's Pass
episodes.description: When Aang and the gang meet up with a group of refugees, they tell the gang where they can get on a ferry to Ba Sing Se. But after a series of events they have to take a deadly route called the serpent's pass with the help of an old friend, Suki. Meanwhile, Zuko and Iroh meet up with a boy named Jet and his freedom fighters.

episodes.title: The Drill
episodes.description: Having made it to the outer wall of Ba Sing Se, the kids confront a Fire Nation army that is driving a massive Fire Nation drill, which poses an imminent threat to the last Earth Kingdom stronghold. Meanwhile, Zuko and Iroh make crucial mistakes which begin to attract Jet's suspicions.

episodes.title: City of Walls and Secrets
episodes.description: Having finally made it into Ba Sing Se, the kids are given a house in the upper ring. The kids are anxious to tell the Earth King their plan but there are complications. Meanwhile, still convinced that Iroh and Zuko may be Fire Nation, Jet decides to take matters into his own hands and do whatever it takes to get the refugees to reveal their true nature.

episodes.title: The Tales of Ba Sing Se
episodes.description: A series of short stories, highlighting different characters and their individual adventures in the city. Tales of Katara and Toph, Iroh, Sokka, Aang, Zuko, and Momo.

episodes.title: Appa's Lost Days
episodes.description: Appa's journey from being abducted in the desert to the present is explored.

episodes.title: Lake Laogai
episodes.description: Aang and his friends continue to search for Appa and, unbeknownst to them, they aren't the only ones looking for him. During their search, the kids meet up with Jet, whom they are understandably reluctant to trust. The kids soon realize that the Dai Li are doing their best to thwart the kids' efforts to find Appa. Meanwhile, Iroh is offered his own tea shop in the upper ring, and Zuko discovers the avatar is in the city.

episodes.title: The Earth King
episodes.description: The kids battle Long Feng and the Dai Li when they attempt to show the Earth King the vast conspiracy taking place in his city. Zuko becomes seriously ill and has feverish dreams as he faces a spiritual crisis.

episodes.title: The Guru
episodes.description: Aang travels to the Eastern Air temple to receive guidance from Guru Pathik while Sokka is reunited with his long-lost father. Meanwhile, Azula has something diabolical in store for her enemies in the Earth Kingdom, including Zuko and Iroh.

episodes.title: The Crossroads of Destiny
episodes.description: Everyone races against time to stop Azula's sinister plan. Zuko finds companionship in an unlikely source. Aang's destiny hangs in the balance—and so does Zuko's, as Iroh tells him it's time to make a choice.

episodes.title: The Awakening
episodes.description: Aang awakens to find himself aboard a captured Fire Nation ship with a full head of hair and sustaining serious injuries from the previous battle for Ba Sing Se. At his side are Katara, Sokka, and their father Hakoda who recount the events that led the four to the ship and contemplate their next move. Aang struggles to fight his own desire to face the Fire Lord before he is ready. Meanwhile, Zuko deals with his own issues as he makes his long-awaited journey home, with the fear of his father's rejection hanging over his head.

episodes.title: The Headband
episodes.description: To better blend in as Fire Nation citizens, Aang enrolls in a Fire Nation school, giving himself an opportunity to learn more about the Nation and to enjoy life as a normal kid for the first time since he discovered he was the Avatar. Meanwhile Zuko, growing more and more paranoid about the Avatar's false demise, brings himself to confront the imprisoned Iroh.

episodes.title: The Painted Lady
episodes.description: When the gang arrives at a suffering fishing village, a mysterious spirit appears to help the villagers.

episodes.title: Sokka's Master
episodes.description: Feeling as though he isn't contributing enough to the group, Sokka seeks out an elusive swordsmaster from whom he can learn the ways of the blade.

episodes.title: The Beach
episodes.description: Zuko, Azula, Mai and Ty Lee take a vacation to Ember Island. In the process, they come to learn more about themselves and each other as well as their desires for the future. Elsewhere, Aang and the others face off against a new adversary.

episodes.title: The Avatar and the Firelord
episodes.description: The tale of Avatar Roku and Fire Lord Sozin is revealed to Aang and Zuko by different sources.  Both learn about themselves and are shown the origins of the war.

episodes.title: The Runaway
episodes.description: When Katara expresses her disapproval of Toph's new way to make quick cash, the group finds her too motherly and tension grows between Katara and Toph. When Katara finally decides to participate in this scam to disprove Toph's accusations, they are left vulnerable and are forced to face the dire consequences.

episodes.title: The Puppetmaster
episodes.description: The gang investigates the bizarre disappearances taking place within an eerie town.

episodes.title: Nightmares and Daydreams
episodes.description: Four days prior the invasion, Aang becomes nervous over his soon-to-come confrontation with the Fire Lord. His anxiety gets the better of him as he begins to suffer from outrageous nightmares and hallucinations. Meanwhile, Zuko becomes upset to learn that he was not informed about a war meeting.

episodes.title: The Day of Black Sun Part 1: The Invasion
episodes.description: The day of the eclipse has arrived, and the invasion force gathers together to make last preparations. They infiltrate the island and the battle begins. Meanwhile, Aang searches for the Fire Lord.

episodes.title: The Day of Black Sun Part 2: The Eclipse
episodes.description: As the invasion force fights their way to the Fire Nation capital, the kids help Aang find the Fire Lord in time for the eclipse. Zuko confronts his father with shocking news.

episodes.title: The Western Air Temple
episodes.description: Aang and the group arrive at the Western Air Temple, with Zuko in pursuit. Zuko wishes to help the Avatar end the war by teaching him firebending.

episodes.title: The Firebending Masters
episodes.description: While teaching Aang firebending, Zuko realizes that he has lost all his firebending skills. To regain his powers, Zuko and Aang must seek the original source of firebending within the ruins of a lost civilization.

episodes.title: The Boiling Rock Part 1
episodes.description: Sokka wants to break his father out of jail and asks Zuko for information on Fire Nation prisons. Sokka and Zuko head for the Boiling Rock, a prison located in the middle of a volcano, to rescue Sokka's father.

episodes.title: The Boiling Rock Part 2
episodes.description: Zuko and Sokka make new plans to break out of the prison with Suki, Sokka's father and some others while a shocking twist leaves Azula none too happy with her two closest friends.

episodes.title: The Southern Raiders
episodes.description: Katara decides to confront the Fire Nation soldier responsible for her mother's death. Aang tries to talk her out of it, but she doesn't listen.

episodes.title: The Ember Island Players
episodes.description: A play recounting the gang's adventures does not sit well with Aang and his friends, except for Toph who enjoys it very much. Meanwhile, Aang confesses his love to Katara, but the response is ambiguous.

episodes.title: Sozin's Comet Part 1: The Phoenix King
episodes.description: Aang struggles to decide whether or not he has to kill the Fire Lord and, during the night, is drawn toward an island which disappears before morning. Zuko leads the rest of the group to the Earth Kingdom to meet a tracker whom they hope can find Aang. The Fire Lord crowns himself Phoenix King and Aang awakens on the island not knowing where he is.

episodes.title: Sozin's Comet Part 2: The Old Masters
episodes.description: While on the island, Aang seeks guidance from his past lives, but is not pleased with what he is told. The island, in fact, turns out to be a lion turtle from which Aang is given the guidance he had been seeking. Meanwhile, after the tracker is unable to track Aang, the rest of the group decide they must find Iroh. While tracking him down, the group meets up with The Order of the White Lotus, a group that transcends the division of the four nations.

episodes.title: Sozin's Comet Part 3: Into the Inferno
episodes.description: Sokka, Suki, and Toph try to stop the Fire Nation's air fleet. Meanwhile, Zuko and Azula duel in an Agni Kai and Aang confronts the Fire Lord.

episodes.title: Sozin's Comet Part 4: Avatar Aang
episodes.description: Aang is on the offensive after getting hit in the back of his scar and triggering the Avatar State. Meanwhile, after Zuko seems to have the upper hand against Azula, Katara is forced to join the fight when Azula resorts to desperate measures.

episodes.title: Rites of Passage
episodes.description: Farmer, family man and rebel Ragnar Lothbrok is determined to sail west to discover new lands and riches despite an intimidating warning from his village's tyrannical leader, Lord Haraldson, who makes it clear in no uncertain terms that doing so could result in severe consequences.

episodes.title: Wrath of the Northmen
episodes.description: The journey west begins as Ragnar gathers a crew willing to risk their lives to travel into the unknown. Earl Haraldson's paranoia reaches new heights as his fear of Ragnar's success grows.

episodes.title: Dispossessed
episodes.description: Ragnar and his crew return from their trip with treasure, and Earl Haraldson has no choice but to sanction another raid. The west is open for the taking, and the Vikings' world will never be the same.

episodes.title: Trial
episodes.description: Ragnar and his crew sail out with Earl Haraldson's permission.

episodes.title: Raid
episodes.description: A seer reads Earl Haraldson's future and tells him that Ragnar searches for his death.

episodes.title: Burial of the Dead
episodes.description: Ragnar, weak and still hurt, must meet the Earl head-on after it comes to light that Rollo has been tortured on Haraldson’s orders. The two men will come together face to face with a single outcome possible: Only one man will leave this fight alive.

episodes.title: A King's Ransom
episodes.description: Three Viking ships sail toward the Royal Villa of King Aelle in eastern England. Ragnar wants ransom in exchange for peace, but the king has a very different plan in mind.

episodes.title: Sacrifice
episodes.description: The traditional pilgrimage to Uppsala to thank the gods brings a torrent of emotions for Ragnar, Lagertha, and Athelstan. Ragnar, pulling farther away from his wife goes to make peace with the death of his unborn son. Lagertha, still reeling from her miscarriage, wants to find out from the gods if more sons are in her future. As the Vikings come together to sacrifice and give thanks to their gods, Athelstan discovers just how strong his Christian faith still is.

episodes.title: All Change
episodes.description: Ragnar travels to Götaland to help King Horik resolve a land dispute with the area's leader, Jarl Borg. Meanwhile, sickness infects the village of Kattegat, and the people look to Lagertha to help them appease the gods.

episodes.title: Brother's War
episodes.description: The battle begins between Ragnar and King Horik's forces against Jarl Borg; Princess Aslaug makes her way to Kattegat.

episodes.title: Invasion
episodes.description: The time has come for an unlikely alliance to band together for a new raid on England; a storm pushes the Viking fleet to a new destination; Ragnar and his men may have met their match.

episodes.title: Treachery
episodes.description: King Ecbert finds himself facing an entirely new kind of foe; Ragnar races to dominate in the west; Jarl Borg has his own plans in store for the future of Kattegat.

episodes.title: Eye for an Eye
episodes.description: Ragnar and Ecbert come face to face; Jarl Borg rules Kattegat with an iron fist; Rollo must now become the leader his people need in Ragnar's absence.

episodes.title: Answers in Blood
episodes.description: Lagertha and Ragnar unite to try to win Kattegat back from Jarl Borg; Aslaug must face the truth of her prophecies; Athelstan struggles to define his faith; Bjorn must once again make a choice.

episodes.title: Unforgiven
episodes.description: King Horik returns to Kattegat with a surprising proposition for Ragnar; Lagertha runs into a less than enthusiastic homecoming from her new husband; Athelstan becomes confidant to King Ecbert.

episodes.title: Blood Eagle
episodes.description: Ragnar and King Horik clash over how to dispense justice to Jarl Borg. In Wessex, King Aelle arrives and Ecbert has an eye on a new alliance.

episodes.title: Boneless
episodes.description: Princess Aslaug's latest prophecy comes to fruition as she readies to give birth once more. Ragnar, Horik and their new ally Lagertha set sail for Wessex - Ragnar and Horik have very different ideas about the true purpose of this trip.

episodes.title: The Choice
episodes.description: Ragnar's warriors march on to King Ecbert's villa and are met with a surprisingly vicious welcome party.

episodes.title: The Lord's Prayer
episodes.description: Ragnar and King Horik return to Kattegat; Ragnar places his trust in those who have stood by him.

episodes.title: Mercenary
episodes.description: Ragnar and Lagertha's fleets depart Kattegat once more for Wessex and this time they bring a group to colonize there. King Ecbert hosts the Norsemen and proposes a deal. Despite the misgivings of some of the other leaders, Ragnar leads his forces into battle once more, but this time as allies of Wessex.

episodes.title: The Wanderer
episodes.description: Lagertha and Athelstan help to set up the Viking settlement. A mysterious wanderer arrives in Kattegat.

episodes.title: Warrior's Fate
episodes.description: King Ecbert visits the developing Viking settlement as the first harvest is sown.

episodes.title: Scarred
episodes.description: There is bitterness in the camp, Floki is angry over the alliance with Ecbert.

episodes.title: The Usurper
episodes.description: The fleet returns to Kattegat to discover tragic circumstances await.

episodes.title: Born Again
episodes.description: Preparations for the Paris raid pick up speed, and Rollo thinks about the Seer's prophecy.

episodes.title: Paris
episodes.description: The Viking fleet causes panic in Paris. The Emperor Charles declares he will remain in the city.

episodes.title: To the Gates!
episodes.description: The Viking army sets out and Paris goes into lockdown as the army prepares the defense.

episodes.title: Breaking Point
episodes.description: Paris is hit with a second assault. Emperor Charles needs to make a difficult decision.

episodes.title: The Dead
episodes.description: With one last chance to take Paris, Ragnar, and his Vikings troops take a daring chance. Ragnar asks Bjorn for a favor that could change the course of Viking history.

episodes.title: A Good Treason
episodes.description: A dangerously ill Ragnar returns to Kattegat, where his suspected death kicks off a scramble to succeed him. Meanwhile, Lagertha engages in a power struggle with her calculating, former second in command, Kalf. Rollo betrays his heritage and remains in Frankia. Floki pays the price for his brutality against the Christian priest.

episodes.title: Kill the Queen
episodes.description: As Ragnar and Floki remain at odds, Rollo makes great efforts in Paris to win over his new bride, Princess Gisla. Meanwhile, King Ecbert sets the task for his son Aethelwulf to rescue Queen Kwenthrith.

episodes.title: Mercy
episodes.description: Floki learns of the heavy price he has paid for his actions. Rollo finds an unlikely ally in Count Odo. Bjorn has to fight a fierce opponent in the wilderness.

episodes.title: Yol
episodes.description: King Aelle goes to Wessex for Christmas and is not impressed with how family relations are developing. Rollo's future hangs in the balance.

episodes.title: Promised
episodes.description: There's an air of betrayal as those whom Odo trusts plot against him. Ecbert agrees to support Kwenthrith in Mercia. Pregnancy brings happiness to Lagertha and Kalf and a marriage is arranged.

episodes.title: What Might Have Been
episodes.description: Ragnar declares another raid on Paris at the Thing in Kattegat. Ecbert also has a journey in mind as he dispatches Aethelwulf and Alfred on a pilgrimage to Rome.

episodes.title: The Profit and the Loss
episodes.description: In England, King Ecbert's true ambitions are revealed as he plots to gain the crown of Mercia. The Vikings attack Paris with considerable force, but will Rollo's defenses be too much for them to overcome? Meanwhile, Harbard, the mysterious wanderer, returns and causes a stir amongst the women of Kattegat.

episodes.title: Portage
episodes.description: Defeat for the Vikings calls Ragnar's leadership into question as they evacuate their camp and move back down river. Ragnar remains inscrutable until he orders the fleet to beach at a cliff face and unveils an ingenious plan. Rollo and Gisla have news that strengthens Rollo's position at the French Court.

episodes.title: Death All 'Round
episodes.description: The labors of the Vikings eventually bear fruit as, within sight of Paris, they re-launch their boats but this time along with some interesting structures that Floki has built. Aethelwulf and Alfred eventually arrive in Rome and honors are conferred by Pope Leo but relations are not so cordial in Wessex between King Ecbert and the disgruntled King Aelle.

episodes.title: The Last Ship
episodes.description: A ferocious battle between the Vikings and the French eventually comes down to Ragnar against Rollo. The outcome will seal the fate of the two brothers.

episodes.title: The Outsider
episodes.description: Ragnar returns to Kattegat and formulates a plan to head back to Wessex, where he intends to right past wrongs.. Meanwhile, Lagertha plans a power play in Kattegat and Bjorn prepares to fulfill his long-held dream to explore the Mediterranean in a sleek new boat built for him by Floki.

episodes.title: The Vision
episodes.description: The Kattegat locals chide Ragnar that the gods have deserted him as he struggles to crew his voyage to Wessex. It's Bjorn who has charisma now as he prepares to fulfill his long-held dream to explore the Mediterranean in a sleek new boat built for him by Floki. By contrast, Ragnar must accept weathered boats and a crew he has bribed but when Aslaug foresees that the fleet will be lost in a vicious storm her warnings go un-heeded by Ragnar and her precious son, Ivar.

episodes.title: Two Journeys
episodes.description: Ragnar's fleet is shipwrecked and washes up on the Wessex coast, but without enough survivors to form a credible force, Ragnar and Ivar have a difficult decision to make. Rollo meets his Viking comrades again and can't resist the urge to join Bjorn's voyage, risking his marriage and his new Frankish identity. Ragnar too is taking a risk as he carries Ivar towards the Royal Villa in Wessex – throwing himself and his son upon the mercy of King Ecbert.

episodes.title: In the Uncertain Hour Before the Morning
episodes.description: Ragnar's faith is tested.

episodes.title: All His Angels
episodes.description: Ragnar's fate is decided.

episodes.title: Crossings
episodes.description: Bjorn's fleet sails onward and launches a surprise attack. Back in Kattegat, Lagertha continues in her quest for power.

episodes.title: The Great Army
episodes.description: The Viking army begins to gather in Kattegat. Lagertha must remain vigilant in the absence of her son, Bjorn.

episodes.title: Revenge
episodes.description: Ragnar's plan comes to fruition. The Viking army lands on the coast of Northumbria.

episodes.title: On the Eve
episodes.description: The Viking army causes panic in the English countryside as King Ecbert and Aethelwulf plan the defense of the realm.

episodes.title: The Reckoning
episodes.description: Prince Aethelwulf finds himself subject to the Vikings' battle master plan. Ecbert remains behind with a plan of his own.

episodes.title: The Departed (1)
episodes.description: Guided by Bishop Heahmund's visions, the Saxons devise a battle plan. Ivar the Boneless strategizes on his own as the Vikings undergo increasing pressure. Bjorn Ironside finds himself in a new territory and must convince the local commander he is a trader and not a raider.

episodes.title: The Departed (2)
episodes.description: As the Vikings establish their stronghold in York, Ivar is determined to lead the Great Army. In Kattegat, Lagertha misjudges King Harald and pays a heavy price. Floki arrives at a mysterious land.

episodes.title: Homeland
episodes.description: Celebrations are cut short in the aftermath of the battle at York. Ragnar Lothbrok's sons are pitted against each other as tensions reach an all-time high, and each is forced to choose a side.

episodes.title: The Plan
episodes.description: Guided by Heahmund's visions, the Saxons devise a battle plan. Ivar the Boneless strategises as the Vikings undergo increasing pressure. Bjorn Ironside finds himself in a new territory and must convince the local commander he is a trader.

episodes.title: The Prisoner
episodes.description: Ivar meets his match in Heahmund. Floki returns to Kattegat. Bjorn receives a lavish welcome in North Africa.

episodes.title: The Message
episodes.description: Lagertha is betrayed, and Bjorn must find a way to support the distraught queen. Floki and his settlers arrive in a new land, but it is far from what they expected.

episodes.title: Full Moon
episodes.description: Bjorn returns to Kattegat to learn that an attack will take place during the next full moon. Ivar must decide if he can place his trust in a former enemy on the battlefield.

episodes.title: The Joke
episodes.description: The battle for Kattegat begins and, as the two armies line up to fight, the Great Heathen Army must decide between a final plea for peace or all-out war. Floki faces discord among the settlers.

episodes.title: A Simple Story
episodes.description: The army leaders consider their options in the aftermath of the battle. In Floki's camp, all hopes of binding the community together are dashed as tragedy unfolds.

episodes.title: Moments of Vision
episodes.description: A sense of doom looms over Kattegat as bloodshed ensues. The defeated army flees in the face of the victors. A legendary warrior makes his way home.

episodes.title: The Revelation
episodes.description: Ivar is crowned the new king of Kattegat just in time to welcome Rollo home. Bjorn, Lagertha and Ubbe must rely on unsteady alliances to survive.

episodes.title: Murder Most Foul
episodes.description: Bjorn, Lagertha and Ubbe face an uncertain fate as Heahmund's loyalty is tested. Floki fights to understand the will of the gods. Ivar may have met his match.

episodes.title: A New God
episodes.description: Heahmund must try to convince King Alfred that his actions are in defense of the Crown. Ubbe and Torvi strengthen the position of the Vikings but not all in the Viking camp support their strategy. Another settler disappears in Iceland.

episodes.title: The Lost Moment
episodes.description: As the celebrations for Ivar continue in Kattegat, grief hits Iceland and Floki must now make a fated decision. Harald's army approaches Wessex. A conspiracy grows against King Alfred.

episodes.title: Hell
episodes.description: Bishop Heahmund is wracked with guilt as he fights to renounce his passions. Viking will clash with Saxon on the battlefield leaving a key figure lost in the balance.

episodes.title: The Buddha
episodes.description: Bjorn achieves one of Ragnar's dreams. Ivar hatches a new plan while preparing for a divine arrival. In Iceland, a settler returns in a terrible state. King Alfred faces his greatest threat yet.

episodes.title: The Most Terrible Thing
episodes.description: An unexpected turn amongst the settlers leaves Floki powerless. King Alfred confronts Judith. In York, Bjorn must strike a deal with Harald. Wessex is once again threatened by a Viking force, but who will lead the Saxon army to defend the Realm?

episodes.title: Baldur
episodes.description: Hvitserk is severely tested. Floki makes an amazing discovery. Freydis gives Ivar a surprise. Ubbe negotiates with the three Danish Kings that have massed their armies in Reading, but the negotiations may have a perilous outcome.

episodes.title: What Happens in the Cave
episodes.description: Ubbe is forced into hand-to-hand combat. Floki reaches new depths and is met by a shocking sight. Bjorn sets off for Scandinavia with an old rival.

episodes.title: Ragnarok
episodes.description: A new battle for Kattegat is on and only the gods know who will emerge victorious.

episodes.title: New Beginnings
episodes.description: It’s six months after the battle of Kattegat and Bjorn is now King. As he struggles with the responsibilities of kingship, he finds he can’t rely on his mother. Ivar falls into the hands of the Kievan Rus, and in their ruthless and unpredictable ruler, Prince Oleg, he may finally have met his match.

episodes.title: The Prophet
episodes.description: Messengers arrive in Kattegat with news that presents Bjorn with a dilemma. Prince Oleg of Kiev seems untroubled by his conscience. Lagertha has settled into her new, peaceful life, but danger lurks nearby.

episodes.title: Ghosts, Gods and Running Dogs
episodes.description: Lagertha is forced to take action. In Kiev, although Oleg continues to be friendly, Ivar is aware of the threat which Oleg poses to the vulnerable young heir to the throne. Bjorn has answered the call and come to the aid of an old enemy.

episodes.title: All the Prisoners
episodes.description: Lagertha leads her village's response to the recent attacks, but despite her best efforts, the consequences are tragic. Olaf has a bold new plan for the future of Norway. Ivar discusses Oleg's ambitions for Scandinavia.

episodes.title: The Key
episodes.description: As Norway’s Kings and Jarls arrive at Harald’s territory for the election of the King of all Norway, Olaf is certain of the result, however, it may not go as smoothly as he believes. Lagertha’s village is anxious in anticipation of another attack and she is relieved when Gunnhild arrives with re-enforcements. In Kiev, Igor and Ivar engage in subterfuge and Ivar is stunned when he encounters a ghost from his past.

episodes.title: Death and the Serpent
episodes.description: Bjorn is forced to act quickly in the aftermath of the election for the king of all Norway. The Bandits attack Lagertha’s village again confident of an easy victory. However, when the defense boils down to single combat with Lagertha, victory seems less likely. In Kattegat, haunted and paranoid, Hvitserk continues to unravel.

episodes.title: The Ice Maiden
episodes.description: Bjorn returns to Kattegat. Harald gains a measure of revenge on Olaf. In Kiev, interesting news reaches Ivar and Igor about Prince Dir.

episodes.title: Valhalla Can Wait
episodes.description: Bjorn faces a difficult decision. Ubbe and Torvi leave Kattegat in search of new lands and perhaps old friends. Oleg's plans for the invasion of Scandinavia take shape. King Harald is baffled by the origin of a mysterious raiding party.

episodes.title: Resurrection
episodes.description: In Iceland, Ubbe and Torvi finally meet a mysterious wanderer. Bjorn is forced to re-think who his enemies are when Erik returns from a scouting mission with worrying information. Bjorn will need allies, but he may not be able to convince his old foe, King Harald, to join forces in the face of the new threat. Ivar is reunited with someone close to him.

episodes.title: The Best Laid Plans
episodes.description: Ivar and Igor may be plotting against Oleg, but they're still part of the force that departs Kiev to invade Scandinavia. King Harald and King Bjorn begin furious preparations for the invasion.

episodes.title: King of Kings
episodes.description: In Iceland, Ubbe learns the truth about Kjetill and has a difficult decision to make. Back in Norway, the battle against the Rus has had grave consequences. But re-enforcements have arrived, and Bjorn has an idea that may yet save the day.

episodes.title: All Change
episodes.description: Ubbe persuades the settlers in Iceland to embark on a voyage of exploration. The defeat of the Rus creates power vacuums in both Kattegat and Kiev.

episodes.title: The Signal
episodes.description: The election for Kattegat's new ruler is held, but a surprise visitor disrupts the proceedings. Ivar puts his plan to overthrow Oleg into action.

episodes.title: Lost Souls
episodes.description: As his enemies scheme for power, Harald prepares for his coronation and chooses a queen. Ubbe's party reaches shore — but not the one they're seeking.

episodes.title: All at Sea
episodes.description: Factions in Greenland spill blood, driving Ubbe's company away. Troops under Ivar and Dir seize Kiev for Prince Igor. Gunnhild makes a fateful choice.

episodes.title: The Final Straw
episodes.description: Ubbe and his followers languish on the open sea. Ivar and Hvitserk receive a frosty reception in Kattegat, until a restless Ivar has a revelation.

episodes.title: The Raft of Medusa
episodes.description: Ivar and Hvitserk lead King Harald's army to England, where King Alfred of Wessex abandons his royal villa and marches to meet the sons of Ragnar.

episodes.title: It's Only Magic
episodes.description: King Alfred falls ill as the Viking army seizes the high ground. Ingrid curses Erik. Ubbe and his people find a new world — but they're not alone.

episodes.title: The Lord Giveth...
episodes.description: Ubbe and the settlers open relations with the indigenous people of the new land. Ivar's strategy lures Alfred's forces into a devastating battle.

episodes.title: The Last Act
episodes.description: Ubbe reunites with an old friend but must pass judgment on a killer. The armies of Alfred and Ivar clash as each leader looks to his god for strength.
